page.title: 02FARMING NEAR COUSLAND
page.content: A 220 ACRE MIXED ARABLE AND LIVESTOCK FARM IS ONE OF SIX FARMS OWNED BY THE ORR FAMILY. THE MAIN CROPS ARE SPRING AND WINTER BARLEY,WINTER WHEAT,HAY AND SILAGE,FODDER RAPE AND KALE FOR SHEEP AND CATTLE FEED,POTATOES AND TURNIPS. THE CROPS ARE GROWN IN A TEN YEAR ROTATION TO PREVENT DISEASE.MORE LAND IS NOW USED FOR CROPS, BECAUSE THE E.E.C.GRANTS SYSTEM HAS MADE GRAIN MORE PROFITABLE. DURING AUTUMN AND WINTER, THERE MAY BE 1000-1500 LAMBS, BOUGHT AT MARKETS THROUGHOUT SCOTLAND, BEING FATTENED FOR THREE MONTHS ON THE FARM.IN WINTER 250 BULLOCKS AND HEIFERS ARE FATTENED FOR SLAUGHTER.THE ANIMALS ARE SELDOM ENTERED FOR SHOWS.
